summary: This is an email exchange between Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim and an MDC staff member regarding a security breach of the Zoom platform used for attorney-client communications. Sternheim reports that third parties accessed the Zoom room, compromising privileged communications, and requests a return to a more secure WebEx platform.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney who is raising concerns about a security breach on the MDC Zoom platform that compromised privileged attorney-client communications.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the high-profile case, whose privileged communications with her attorney were potentially compromised by a Zoom platform breach.

connections.description: Sternheim is Maxwell's defense attorney, as evidenced by her advocating for secure communication channels to protect their privileged discussions.

events.title: Zoom Security Breach at MDC
events.description: Third parties accessed the Zoom room used by Ghislaine Maxwell and her counsel for privileged communications, a breach reported to and witnessed by MDC staff.

events.title: Initial Security Concern Raised
events.description: Bobbi Sternheim initially raised concerns about the security of the MDC Zoom platform, warning it did not preclude third-party interference with privileged communications.

events.title: MDC Response to Security Breach
events.description: An MDC staff member (sender 'I=Ell') responds to Sternheim, explaining the breach was due to a miscommunication and that a new, more secure line is being created.

locations: MDC (Metropolitan Detention Center, Brooklyn, NY - implied location for the Zoom platform)
225 Broadway, Suite 715, New York, NY 10007 (Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim)
keyFacts: A security breach occurred on the MDC Zoom platform, allowing third parties to access the Zoom room used for Ghislaine Maxwell's privileged attorney-client communications.
Defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim reported the breach to MDC staff and requested an immediate reversion to the more secure Cohen & Gresser WebEx platform.

The MDC response acknowledged the breach was due to an internal miscommunication and that the provided address was a secure line already in use, with efforts underway to create a new, more secure line.
This incident highlights ongoing concerns about maintaining confidential attorney-client communications in high-profile cases within detention facilities.
